title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 57.11 - Requirements for commercial pullet grower flocks
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 57.11 - Requirements for commercial pullet grower flocks

State Regulations
(a) Chicks shall originate in parent flocks
meeting the requirements of section
57.10
of this Part. (b) Prior to the placement of new chicks in a
house, it is recommended that the house be cleaned and disinfected. (c) Cage paper and litter shall be sampled
and tested as provided in section
57.8
(b) of this

Part when the chicks are between five and fifteen days of age. (d) Manure shall be sampled and tested as
provided in section
57.8
(b) of this

Part when the chicks are between 10 and 15 weeks of age. (e) Incoming chicks and outgoing pullets
shall be transported only in cleaned and disinfected crates and
vehicles. (f) Routine diagnostic
specimens shall be tested as provided in section
57.9
(b)(1)
of this

Part. (g) Flocks containing less
than 3,000 birds shall be exempt from the sampling and testing required by this
section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
57.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
